adhdAssessment.title: Children's ADHD Assessment
adhdAssessment.subtitle: A comprehensive evaluation for children ages 6-12 based on the Vanderbilt ADHD Rating Scale

disclaimer.simple: This tool helps you understand your attention patterns - not a medical diagnosis

aboutScale.title: About the Vanderbilt Scale
aboutScale.content: The Vanderbilt ADHD Rating Scale is a widely-used, evidence-based assessment tool that evaluates attention, hyperactivity, and impulsivity symptoms across multiple domains.

features.professional: Based on clinically validated assessment tools
features.comprehensive: Evaluates both inattention and hyperactivity symptoms

infoStep.title: Assessment Information
infoStep.subtitle: Please provide basic information for this assessment
infoStep.subject: Who is this assessment for?
infoStep.subjectPlaceholder: e.g., myself, my child, my spouse

questions.question1: Fails to give close attention to details or makes careless mistakes in work, school, or other activities
questions.question2: Has difficulty sustaining attention in tasks or play activities
questions.question3: Does not seem to listen when spoken to directly
questions.question4: Does not follow through on instructions and fails to finish work, chores, or duties
questions.question5: Has difficulty organizing tasks and activities
questions.question6: Avoids, dislikes, or is reluctant to engage in tasks that require sustained mental effort
questions.question7: Loses things necessary for tasks or activities (e.g., tools, papers, keys, wallet)
questions.question8: Is easily distracted by external stimuli or unrelated thoughts
questions.question10: Fidgets with hands or feet or squirms in seat
questions.question11: Leaves seat in situations where remaining seated is expected
questions.question12: Runs about or climbs excessively in inappropriate situations
questions.question13: Has difficulty playing or engaging in leisure activities quietly
questions.question14: Is 'on the go' or often acts as if 'driven by a motor'
questions.question16: Blurts out answers before questions have been completed
questions.question18: Interrupts or intrudes on others (e.g., butts into conversations or games)

results.title: Assessment Results
results.subtitle: Based on your responses to the Vanderbilt ADHD Rating Scale
results.subject: Subject
results.recommendation: Consider consulting with a healthcare professional for further evaluation.

low.title: Low Risk for ADHD
low.description: Your responses suggest a low likelihood of ADHD symptoms. This indicates good attention regulation and impulse control in most situations.

moderate.title: Moderate Risk for ADHD
moderate.description: Your responses indicate some attention or hyperactivity concerns that may benefit from further evaluation or targeted strategies.

high.title: High Risk for ADHD
high.description: Your responses suggest significant attention and/or hyperactivity symptoms that warrant professional evaluation. Many of these symptoms appear to occur frequently.

results.gameRecommendationsSubtitle: Based on your assessment results, these games can help strengthen attention and focus:

gameDescriptions.dual-n-back: Enhance working memory and executive attention control
gameDescriptions.stroop-effect-test: Improve cognitive flexibility and inhibition control
gameDescriptions.larger-number: Sharpen processing speed and attention to detail
